intro: Achillea macrophylloides, commonly known as the giant yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright growth habit and large, feathery leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in traditional herbal remedies.
